label: 戦国
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: The period of the warring states which lasted from the beginning of the Ōnin War in 1467 to 1568, when Oda Nobunaga entered Kyoto to assert national hegemony. Some scholars date the beginning of the period in 1490, when the shogunal deputy (kanrei) took over actual control of the Ashikaga bakufu. See also gekokujō, sengoku daimyo, and shugo daimyo.　[応仁の乱、織田信長、管領、足利幕府、下剋上、戦国大名、守護大名]
